ReviewList.Text: Wow! This read had me on the edge of my seat the entire time I was reading it. The author's writing style is as enjoyable as it is unique, making this a book I'll recommend to all of my friends. I devoured this quick read in just one sitting and will definitely read the next addition to the series. Well done!

A great and engaging kick off of what promises to be a great apocalyptic novel. The world end type of setting can easily become a boring read without the right plot and intrigue - and "Angle Wars" definitely defeats any menace of becoming boring even from the this introductory part one. When human kind is threatened by the deadliest virus that has ever been seen, what happens next becomes intense, fast paced and filled with suspense. A good apocalyptic book, engaging and thought provoking.

Did I miss something? This was an expensive short story! It was primarily a purchased poorly edited advertisement for an interesting premise. I admit I was suckered into it. Never again will I purchase this author's work on principle!

Wow, this book will definitely expand your thinking while offering you an exciting read. The scenes and adjoining events adds much twists and turns to the story, plus the characters will stun you! I enjoyed it!
Join the team now in order to survive the upcoming apocalypse. Surely, this fun and fast pace book is amazing. The story line flows smoothly and the imageries were vivid and unique. Thumbs up!
This book was free and I am still upset by how badly it was edited and written. I guess you get what you pay for. Nothing for nothing.

Apocalyptic types of book are definitely my favorite genre, so this book has some stiff competition. That being said, I thoroughly enjoyed this! It was a quick read, but was nonstop action and suspense throughout. As a deadly, contagious virus surrounds the land, a group of people from Hollow Creek must band together to try to fight it before the world is completely destroyed. The story takes you alongside them on their journey. 5 stars for me!

I purchased this book thinking it was a full novel.  What I received was just a teaser not a book. The last page asked if you liked it and wanted more but no way to download the whole book.  From what I did read I found the story line jumped around a bit and it seemed like something was missing.  the dialogue did not seem like natural conversation to me.  The book also needed a good proofreader.
